results.title: Thief of hearts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stewart, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Ray (John Getz) and Mickey (Barbara Williams) Davis were the perfect married couple, or so everyone thought. Bored with her workaholic and disinterested husband, Mickey turns to her diary as an outlet, writing down her innermost sexual fantasies and desires. This is until the Davis’ home is burgled and the robber takes off with not only an assortment of valuables, but also Mickey’s secret diary. The thief, Scott Muller (Steven Bauer), soon finds himself obsessed with Mickey after reading her diary and plots and plans his way into meeting and seducing her. Mickey and Ray’s life is turned inside out whilst Muller’s obsession almost destroys him. Erotic thriller of the 80s with 80s soundtrack featuring Giorgio Moroder and Melissa Manchester. Includes a cameo role by a very young David Caruso (of NYPD Blues TV series fame) and support cast including George Wendt and Christine Ebersole.

results.title: They shoot horses don't they
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Robert Chartoff, Irwin Winkler, Winkler Production, Chartoff and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The year is 1932 and it is the height of the Depression. In order to win prize money various couples sign on for a gruelling dance marathon lasting over 1,000 hours and in which they will be treated as performing animals, prodded into increasingly desparate acts in order to survive the continuous dancing. This is a stunning and deeply evocative film about a period in American history when desperation forced people into cruelty and debasement. The film features a stunning performance by Jane Fonda as the bitter survivor, Gloria, an outstanding performance by Gig Young as the cynical MC and brilliant direction by Sydney Pollack. Fonda’s performance elevated her reputation as the leading English-language actress of her generation. Faultless in script, direction and performances, “They Shoot Horses, Don’t They?” is still a remarkably moving and disquieting film.

results.title: They reckon a woman's world's just it and a bit
results.creator_credit: Meg Stewart, Penny Chapman and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Five housewives, living in a housing estate in outer Adelaide, tell how they organized a mutual self-help group to overcome the boredom, frustration and loneliness of living in suburbia.

results.title: They found a cave
results.creator_credit: Andrew Steane, Charles E. Wolnizer and Australian Council for Children's Film and Television
results.brief_description: They found a cave: Four English orphans migrate to Tasmania under the care of their Aunt. Their Aunt becomes sick and is hospitalised, leaving the children to seek refuge in a secret cave. Excitement follows the children as they face danger and adventure in the rugged terrain before they are finally reunited with their Aunt. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
